title: Global track finding based on the Hough transform in the STCF detector
authors:
Hang Zhou, Kexin Sun, Zhenna Lu, Hao Li, Xiaocong Ai, Jin Zhang,
  Xingtao Huang and Jianbei Liu
abstract:
The proposed Super Tau-Charm Facility (STCF) is an electron-positron collider
designed to operate in a center-of-mass energy range from 2 to 7 GeV. It
provides a unique platform for physics research in the tau-charm energy region.
To fulfill the physics goals of STCF, high tracking efficiency and good
momentum resolution is required for charged particles with momenta from 50
MeV/c to 3.5 GeV/c. A global track finding algorithm based on Hough transform
has been developed and implemented in the STCF software framework to meet this
requirement. The design of the algorithm and its performance with simulation
are presented in this paper.
